On arrival hotel looked ok at reception, up to the room it was so dark, brown and blue carpet, dark furniture, dark beige on the walls,  these room need to be a bit brighter and move away from carpets in them very unhygienic.   Bathroom was clean but no walk in shower, shower over a bath not suitable for people that can’t easily get in and out a bath.  The room lighting was so poor despite ample lighting outlets, just a change of bulb colour would have made a space more welcoming, they had a microwave and a fridge that was good, also had  two TVs in the room, one in the bed area and one in the seating area. The room was large enough that I could do my on-line exercise class at one end, while my husband watched TV from the other.  Room was very clean--no concerns there.  Very convenient to have breakfast in the same building.   On occasion I had to ask for something (a second washcloth, more toilet paper), but these requests were always responded to with a smile.  We plan on staying here again.

I went downstairs and asked and they checked and saw that we had indeed made a reservation for 3 and not two so they changed our rooms without hesitation. The first room backed onto Los Aliso so it was a bit noisy with cars until the traffic slowed down but picked up first thing in the morning again. The pool was next door but the room key let us in and towels were available. The breakfast was much better than most with plenty of choices.

My husband and I were not disappointed.The hotel was busy due to the holiday weekend but was quiet at night. Our room was larger than most other hotels with a separate sitting room.  Two TV's, one in bed area and the other in the sitting area.  The bed was very comfortable with glass topped night stands with good lighting. Breakfast is included in the room rate and is a delicious hot buffet  breakfast with many choices. Scrambled eggs, sausage, hash browns, waffles, and both oatmeal and cold cereal. We didn't have time to book any of the spa services. We will definitely book this hotel in the future.

We were so surprised at how huge the rooms were and it was nice to have a sitting area and a bedroom area separate.  There was also a wet bar area in the sitting room with a fridge(worked great) and a microwave(didn't work well at all), coffee maker, etc that was nice to keep our vitamins, snacks on.   There were 2 TVs in the room - one in the sitting area and one in the bedroom.  I would have preferred to watch the one in the sitting area but it never worked.  The bathroom was nice and big and the water pressure was nice.  The bed was a little soft for me but the sheets were very smooth and pillows comfortable.   The breakfast was quite good but didn't change much

We didn’t spend a lot of time in the room except to sleep at night; however, we thought the room was comfortable and clean.   The breakfasts had egg options and sausage with the traditional oatmeal, cereal, yogurt, etc. The eggs tasted like they were powder ones but maybe they weren’t. The courtyard area was charming with a fountain and it had a fire pit with plenty of seating areas.   I have never stayed at an Ayres Hotel before and found it to be very comfortable.

A full hot breakfast comes with your room which makes the overall stay very affordable.  They also have a small bar area with a great selection of craft beers. The corner suite is extremely awkward in terms of space layout with doors opening and giving you 4 to 6 inches of space between you and the bed you at a toilet you in other parts of the room. Don't know why I would pay extra for this. Seems like this room should've been discounted rather than charge more. Peeked into another room down the hall which was not a corner suite and much more standard in size and layout. With plenty of room. I paid way too much for this hotel stay. Breakfast was so so at best. Food was cold ,  tables were dirty, just a standard continental breakfast with some cold eggs and came with  sausage or slice of bacon.  I would definitely not return . Also had a spa treatment for myself and daughter.

Our double queen suite was excellent - extremely spacious, spotless, and comfortable.  The beds, though softer than I how I like it, were very comfortable. Pillows were reasonable (I usually find hotel pillows to be awful across the board). Spacious bathroom with an excellent showerhead.

Summary: When in the country, I travel to So. California every other month to visit with my brother, sister and friends. It's always special to me, as I grew up on the Orange County beaches...but some time ago, I abandoned the beaches when it came to hotels. "Why?" you might ask. Well, I'll tell you. So many of the beach hotels have become tired and worn out, and far too pricey for what they offer.   Also, there's a secret that only a guy like me who grew up on the Orange County beaches can tell you: if you want sun in abundance, it won't happen at the beach. You see, with the exception of winter months, sunny mornings are a rarity at the So. California beaches, and "June Gloom" appears most mornings...into the afternoon. Furthermore, in the winter the beach is a good ten degrees cooler.

Summary: The hotel room was everything we wanted: clean, bright, comfortable.  For us, the property was ideally located. The staff was very pleasant and helpful.  Breakfast was just okay, but no complaints.  We certainly would stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights following a cruise and were pleasantly surprised by how well managed the property was. Large, modern rooms with many amenities combined with great service made it a pleasure to stay.
Manager Response: Dear TravlinfoolSeattle,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent experience at our hotel. We are so pleased to see that you thoroughly enjoyed your stay following your cruise. Thank you for the compliments on our large and modern rooms with extra amenities. We cannot thank you enough for your kind feedback and hope to welcome you another time in the near future.  Sincerely,  Didi Shields General Manager

Summary: Love this place! Women's church retreat with gorgeous grounds, meeting rooms and excellent food. I would definitely recommend this hotel & spa to anyone looking for a retreat or just a great place to stay.
Manager Response: Dear Stacey J,  We cannot thank you enough for taking the time to recommend our hotel on TripAdvisor. We are so very pleased to see that you enjoyed your women's church retreat with us. It is nice to know that you found the grounds to be gorgeous, the meeting rooms and food to be excellent. We hope you will visit another time soon and thank you again!  Sincerely,  Didi Shields General Manager

Summary: The beds are very comfortable and the rooms are a nice size.  But, the nicest thing here is the service.  They clean the rooms early, and although the hotel is not brand new, you can tell that they make a special effort to make sure everything is very clean.
Manager Response: Dear Greg W,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a kindly worded review on TripAdvisor to let others know about how excellent your stay with us was. We are so pleased to see that you find that the nicest thing about our hotel is our service, it is truly what we strive for. Thank you for the compliments on the cleanliness and upkeep, they are much appreciated. We hope to see you another time in the near future and thank you again.  Sincerely,  Didi Shields General Manager

Summary: Convenient location,  clean, quiet, large rooms, with flat screen tv, fridge, micro. Nice breakfast buffet with hot foods. Walking distance to grocery store. I like the inside rooms that face the courtyard if you open your window you can hear the fountain. Great place to stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Everything you need including great service for a very reasonable price!
Summary: We needed a place near friends and this was 2 miles away but were concerned that there was nothing decent there without paying a fortune.  This was perfect.  The room was very clean and comfortable with a much appreciated refrigerator and microwave and the sitting area was invaluable to put my daughters crib so she wouldn't wake up and see me immediately. She slept like a log.  Breakfast was far better than most suites Continental breakfast and included waffles, eggs and sausage.  There wasn't much more we could have wanted for.  But mostly, the staff was incredibly accommodating and went out of their way to make me and my daughter comfortable, even loaning us an extra pack-n-play for times we were out of the hotel and she needed to nap.  I can't say enough nice things about the
Manager Response: Dear Amy R,  We are so very pleased to see that you thoroughly enjoyed your visit with us. It was so kind of you to write a glowing 5 star review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your stay. Thank you for the compliments on the high quality service, it is truly what we strive for. It is also nice to know you enjoyed the complimentary full American breakfast and found your accommodations to be comfortable. We hope to see you another time in the near future and thank you again.  Sincerely,  Didi Shields General Manager

Summary: Our room was in the second floor facing the courtyard. It was very quiet. Furniture looked new and free of blemishes and scratches. The room was very well appointed with a small refrigerator, coffee maker, and microwave oven. What really surprised me was how clean the room was. I could not find even a single hair left in the bathroom. Glass and mirror surfaces were free of finger prints. This level of detail is at the level of 5 star hotels. The location is slightly farther than I wanted, but we were rewarded by the quality and tranquility of the surrounding area. The hotel has a basic small gym with treadmills, ellipticals and a bench with a good set of dumbbells for those like me who want to exercise. Free breakfast was good with a small variety of hot foods, cereal, waffle
Manager Response: Dear Tsai C,  Thank you very much for taking the time to let others know how pleasant your recent stay with us was on TripAdvisor. It is nice to know that you enjoyed your room accommodations and found them to be well appointed and clean. Your compliments of the tranquil and peaceful location and atmosphere are greatly appreciated. We are so pleased to see that you enjoyed the complimentary breakfast buffet and fitness room. We hope to see you another time in the near future and thank you again.  Sincerely, Didi Shields General Manager

Summary: We had a room on the top floor (3) near the elevator on a Sunday night, but it was very quiet and very close to the car. The hotel is two years old and the beds were comfortable but not firm enough for me. Breakfast if complimentary and hot with many things except fresh fruit. The reception and spa personnel were professional but not warm enough for greeting people. They warm up after a long while. The spa technicians do a good job, and all the treatments are great. There is an almost "mandatory" 20% tip on the "before promotion" spa services that ends up very expensive and feels unfair. You can tell it is really not welcome to tip lower than that. The spa is only on appointment with cancelation fee if under 3 days.   I would avoid Piccolino restaurant heavily advertised by the
Manager Response: Dear Pourpre,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your stay at our hotel. We are pleased to see that you found the hotel to be quiet, have a decent complimentary full American breakfast buffet, and a good spa. The 20% is a suggested gratuity rate and is not intended to feel unfair, it is there for clarification. We sincerely apologize if you felt differently. We cannot wait to welcome you another time soon on a day the on-site restaurant will be open for your enjoyment. Thank you again.  Sincerely,  Didi Shields General Manager

Summary Heading: Ayers hotel and Spa Mission Viejo
Summary: We read great reviews about all the Ayers hotels, and especially the one in Mission Viejo...so, when we took a family trip south to several amusement parks in So.Cal, we decided to drive a little farther away to stay in a more relaxed environment than Anaheim had to offer.  Rachel Russo, our front desk attendant, arranged for our party to have two adjacent rooms with a connecting door.  Well, the hotel was very clean...staff was pleasant...breakfast was great...rooms were nice...and it was QUIET.  We will definitely stay at the Ayers again !!  And we will ask for Rachel again...she was very nice and helpful in making sure we had a great stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Ayers Hotel and Spa Mission Viejo
Summary: Our company had our Christmas party at a local country club, the Ayers hotel was the closet place to our event. This could not have been a better choice. The staff was more than attenitive. Tasha ( Front Desk ) asked if we would like a shuttle to our party since we had multiple people at the hotel. I said yes and she made all the arrangements and contacted each of us individuallly with the arrangements. Other staff members of note were Nick ( Front Desk ) and Paoul ( Bartender) All of them exhibited the highest quality of service. The rooms well appointed and extremely clean. Breakfast was great with a wide variety of choices and everything made fresh. The value we recieved here far exceeded the price. This is a " Three thumbs up!! " D Byers
Manager Response: Dear Travelinman035,  We were so very honored to host you and your co-workers recently. Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your experience at our hotel. We sincerely appreciate the feedback and are so delighted to see that you felt our service was of the highest quality. Thank you for the compliments on the accommodations and complimentary full American breakfast buffet, we are so pleased to see you enjoyed both. We hope to see you another time in the near future and thank you again.  Sincerely, Didi Shields General Manager

Summary Heading: Ayres Hotel and Spa Mision Viejo - Thumbs down
Summary: I read the reviews of this hotel and decided to give it a try. It was not the nearest hotel to my business meetings but seemed like a nice place to lay my head. To start I will say the general staff was pleasant. The room was less than OK at best - loud humming from in room fridge, a musty smell from AC unit, noise from hallways, noise from next door showers and a very close freeway all have made me give my first bad review on trip advisor after extensive travel. My sleep was interrupted by all the above and the rap on the door from housekeeping at 7:30 am, guess they really wanted to clean my room. My next venture took me to the breakfast hall - loud and crowded as I would expect from a free breakfast. The potatoes were rubber and the sausage gave me halitosis and heart burn
Manager Response: Dear Early H,  Please accept my heartfelt apologies that your stay was anything less than exceptional. It is disappointing to see that your sleep was disrupted by many factors, especially in the case of the housekeeping team, and for that I apologize profusely. I will be sure to follow up with the General Manager to prevent any further issues such as this. In terms of the complimentary breakfast buffet, we regret to see that it left you unsatisfied and upset. We will be sure to keep your comments in mind when making improvements to the hotel, and thank you for your feedback. We hope you will stay with us another time in the near future so that we may redeem ourselves in your eyes. Thank you again.  Sincerely, Matt Hildebrant Director of Revenue & Marketing

Summary Heading: Ayres Hotel & Spa Mission Viejo awesome
Summary: I've stayed at the Ayres hotel & Spa in Mission Viejo for at least 20 days this year for my job. What a beautiful place.  After all the hussell and bussell that SoCal offers, coming to a very quiet and hidden away hotel like this one in Mission Viejo is just the remedy to de-stress.  The restaurant is excellent, a bit pricey but the food and service is wonderful.  My room is always perfectly clean, the hotel looks new so the bathrooms and rooms all have the latest decor.  I enjoy using the workout facility also.  The front staff has never been rude but are just the opposite.  They are kind.and often go out of their way to make sure everything is just right for my stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Spent 9 nights at this lovely place.  The rooms are amazing...spacious and nicely appointed.  Beds and pillows very comfortable.  Breakfast is awesome and the staff that works breakfast are the best...friendly and attentive.  Front desk staff amazing.  Housekeeping, spot on.  Will be back in June!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were directed to the Ayres Hotel and Spa by friends who were getting married nearby.    The Ayres Hotel and Spa is accompanied on the site by the Ayres Suites.  I walked through that property and found the common areas no different from our hotel. I'd assume the sole difference is that the rooms are suites.  We found the Hotel to be pretty much average.  Our room contained a king-sized bed and a very small sitting area with its own TV.  The bathroom was standard, a shower head in a tub with shower curtain.  The room did provide both a small refrigerator and a microwave.  As with many hotel rooms, a desk provided a surface and connection for a single computer, but not two.  The Internet service was free.  However, the room is relatively small.  No one could use both TVs in the
Manager Response: Dear CostaRicaBirder,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a straight forward review on TripAdvisor to let others know your opinion of our hotel and your recent experience here. While we are pleased to see you appreciated the extra room amenities, such as the mini refrigerator and microwave, we are disappointed to see that you did not find your accommodations to be more than average. We offer complimentary WiFi internet, so do not find it necessary to provide two wired connections at the writing desk. We apologize if this was an inconvenience for you. Please accept our deepest apologies if you did not have a more than exceptional stay. We hope you will consider staying with us another time in the future and thank you again.  Sincerely, Didi Shields General Manager

Summary Heading: Great sized rooms with free parking and breakfast.
Summary: We were looking for a clean inexpensive place to stay near a holiday party, and were pleasantly surprised with the Ayres hotel. The rooms are spacious and have a mini fridge and microwave. They also have free parking  and a nice free breakfast. The only down side is it is located off a toll road, be prepared with quarters.
Manager Response: Dear RHOBH_Wannabe,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a flattering review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent experience. We are so delighted to see that you were pleasantly surprised with our hotel. Thank you for the compliments on the spaciousness of the room and extra amenities like the mini refrigerator and microwave. It is also nice to know that you enjoyed the complimentary full American breakfast buffet. Thank you again and we hope to see you another time in the near future.  Sincerely, Didi Shields General Manager

Summary: We always stay at the Ayres when visiting family in the area.  The price is extremely reasonable, the staff is always helpful and friendly, and the breakfast included is a treat for the kids.  There are one bedrooms available, which work perfectly for families.  The location is right off the toll road for easy access.  We love sitting in the courtyard with the fountain and fireplaces too.  Coffee /tea 24 hrs/day and cookies in the evening just top off this stellar hotel!
Manager Response: Dear Excitedtraveler46,  We are so very honored that you choose to stay at our hotel when visiting family in the area. Your compliments of the reasonable price, accommodating service, and complimentary full American breakfast buffet are greatly appreciated. We are so pleased to see that we are able to accommodate you and your family comfortably in our Executive King One Bedroom Suite. We cannot wait to welcome you another time in the near future and thank you for taking the time to leave a flattering review of our hotel.  Sincerely, Didi Shields General Manager

Summary Heading: A hidden delight, and easy on the pocketbook...
Summary: Born and reared in Orange County, I live far away these days, but have the occasion to visit every other month, and have found this hidden jewel to be far and away one of the best finds anywhere.  Some might cry it's too far away, but it's all in their minds... no more than minutes from main thoroughfares and freeways.  The rooms are tastefully decorated, and combine a bedroom area w/GREAT BED and a living room, complete with microwave, refrigerator, and a desk and WIFI.  Breakfast is ample, too.  The public areas are also lovely, and the pool is bright, clean, and nearly always warm enough to sit out for some rays,with lofty views of the entire south county.  I highly recommend.
Manager Response: Dear Michael F.,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a flattering review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent experience at our hotel. We are so pleased you enjoyed your accommodations during your stay, especially in terms of the Ayres Dream Sleeper mattress. Thank you for the compliments on the extra amenities we provide such as complimentary WiFi and the full American breakfast buffet, they are greatly appreciated. We hope to see you another time in the near future and thank you again for taking time to recommend our hotel to others.  Sincerely, Didi Shields General Manager

Summary: It is worth the few extra miles. It was quiet and very well appointed.  I did not have a chance to use any of the spa facilities.  Breakfast was the best I've seen, free, and made to order eggs and omelettes.  Restaurant was good too.  I would stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My girlfriend took me out to this Hotel.  We had bubblies with strawberries and blueberries. Went to Spa great message, at night we enjoyed the hottube all alone. Great breakfast in the morning had eveything from eggs to cereal and yogurt. Did i mention it was free.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is the first time I visited to L.A. I think the environment around the Hotel is enjoyable. The service is good and the room is cleanly. The breakfast at the dining hall is delicious. I really like Ayres hotel. If I have another chance to visit LA, I will definitely live here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel was comfortable, affordable and clean, with spacious, pleasingly decorated guest rooms, and very friendly staff who responded quickly to every request. I purchased my room through Hotwire so my rate was incredibly low -- about half of the hotel's lowest published rate -- so I can't complain! However, I was disappointed in some of my expectations. First of all, the hotel is FAR away from John Wayne airport, and there is NO SHUTTLE, so you'll have to pay for a cab to get here. Second, there is no real bar or cocktail lounge (although you can get a drink) and the restaurant is basic, basic, basic! Burgers and fries dominate the menu, and their signature salad is a WEDGE of lettuce! Plus, the restaurant /bar closes at 9:30, so no enjoying a nightcap and snack if your plane

Please accept our heartfelt apologies if you felt inconvenienced at all by the distance from the airport. Typically guests find our location a nice secluded getaway from the hectic airport area; we are truly sorry if you did not feel the same. Our deepest apologies if the hotel restaurant schedule did not satisfy your wants and needs, we more than strive to make every one of our guest's experiences as exceptional as possible and are devastated to see that we did not succeed in that goal with your stay. We will most definitely take your comments into consideration and thank you for your honesty. We do hope you will come stay with us another time in the near future and thank you again. Summary: We came down for our daughter's wedding and stayed for 5 nights.  The accommodations were great.  The rooms are spacious and very clean.  The staff was very friendly and helped all of the wedding party guest ((approx 50).  The best surprise was the continental breakfast, a great meal with a complete variety of entrees.  To sum it up a wonder stay.
Manager Response: Dear Larry L.,  We were so honored to have you as our guest for your daughter's wedding. Congratulations! Thank you for the flattering 5 star review, we truly appreciate it. We are so pleased to see that you found your accommodations spacious and clean. Thank you for the compliments on the complimentary full American breakfast buffet, we greatly appreciate them. We hope to see you another time in the near future.  Sincerely, Didi Shields General Manager

Summary: The staff was very kind and friendly. They smiled and were available every time we needed them. We slept well in our beautiful room. They were very clean and spacious. The bed and pillows were perfect! Thank you for a very pleasant experience!!!!!
Manager Response: Dear Meshall42,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a glowing review on TripAdvisor to let others know how much you enjoyed your recent visit to our hotel. We appreciate the compliments on how clean and spacious your accommodations were. We are so pleased to see that you thought the bed and pillows were perfect and comfortable. We truly strive to offer the highest quality service to each and everyone of our guests and we are so thrilled to see that we succeeded in that goal with your stay. We hope to see you in the near future and thank you again!  Sincerely, Didi Shields General Manager

Summary: We were here for a marriage retreat with our church.  The rooms were large, and very nice and clean, but the overall amenities are kind of lacking.  If you want to access the pool and jacuzzi, you have to walk all the way across a large parking lot to the Ayres hotel across the way.  And it was super cold outside at night, so we would have froze to death walking back.  Not to mention a large and very drunk wedding party had taken over the jacuzzi, so we passed. The prices at the spa are crazy high, and no spa services discount was offered to our large group for staying there, which is a suggestion I would make. The free breakfast bar is nice, but good, not great.  A little more variety would be nice, and bacon instead of sausage would be nice. For a "spa" place, I would say the
Manager Response: none

Summary: The room was beautiful and well appointed.  We didn't find the beds all that comfortable but the problem is with the service.  On two occasions we couldn't get the key to work to our room and went down to the front desk twice each time to get it fixed.  Very frustrating after a long day of activity not to get into your room and then not be receive friendly service or even an apology when it happened.  The first time it happened on check-in they gave me a different room and did it with a smile, the second time I finally got into the room but I was putting the night kid out by trying to get into my room.
Manager Response: Dear Trinity C.,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a candid review on TripAdvisor to let others know about  your recent experience at our hotel. Please accept my heartfelt apologies on behalf of the team; I am so very sorry  that they did not offer the highest quality service to you during your stay. Our room keys are very sensitive and we apologize for any inconvenience you may have experienced. Thank you for the compliments on the room and we do hope to see you another time in the near future.  Sincerely, Didi Shields General Manager

Summary Heading: Just one more step to greatness...
Summary: This hotel has all the potential to be a GREAT property. When you walk into the lobby, you are greeted warmly with a fire, pleasant aromas from scented candles and a great staff.   The rooms are really spacious with refrigerators, microwaves (never use 'em!), two TV's, sitting areas, desks with internet.   My challenge with the property are picky, but they mean something to someone that is going to be traveling and needs to be able to work.   The chairs at the desk are too low, and they will not raise up. It is just awkward to sit here and write the review.   The second factor is the internet. It is fast but spotty. Last night, it completely went down to the slowest crawl and would not even load up the websites. It was like being a kid again on my 300 baud modem. :)  Other than
Manager Response: Dear Calvenn S.,  Thank you very much for taking the time to write a review on TripAdvisor about your recent visit to our hotel. Please accept our sincerest apologies in relation to the spotty internet connection and the uncomfortable work chair. We will definitely keep your comments in mind when making improvements to the hotel. Other than those issues, we are so pleased to see that you enjoyed your stay. We do hope you will stay with us another time in the near future, thank you again.  Sincerely, Didi Shields General Manager

Summary: Stayed 2 nights at the Mission Viejo location, then one night at Ontario Mills site.  Both were quiet, well tended, and staff were efficient and friendly.  I appreciate the hot breakfasts and good rates.  I'll definitely stay with Ayres again.  (I only give ratings of 5 to hotels that are an amazing experience.)
Manager Response: Dear FormerLAgal,  Thank you very much for taking the time to let others know about your experience at our hotel by leaving a review on TripAdvisor. We sincerely appreciate the compliments on the great value and and efficient service. We are also pleased to see that you enjoyed the complimentary full American breakfast buffet. We hope that you will come to stay another time in the near future so that we may provide you with an amazing experience to capture that 5 star review. Thank you again!  Sincerely, Didi Shields General Manager

Summary: We had a great room and delicious breakfast.  There was a nice area everyone could mingle in the lobby area. The bed was comfortable and the room appointed well.  The hotel staff was nice.  Everything was really great.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel was full and the service was poor.  The king rooms are very poorly laid out and the furniture is very cheap.  The sliding mirrored closet doors did not fit the track and kept falling off. Had a hard time getting an iron and ironing board.  Poor value for the money.
Manager Response: Dear TBoa,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a candid review of your experience at our hotel on TripAdvisor. Typically we receive a great amount of praise for our decor and are surprised to see your opposing opinion. Nonetheless, thank you for these comments about the furniture and mirrors, we will definitely keep them in mind when refurbishing. Thank you again and we do hope you will reconsider staying with us in the future.  Sincerely, Didi Shields General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel in a quiet suburban area
Summary: We spent a few nights in Mission Viejo during a stop for the Oddball Comedy Festival in Irvine, CA (only about 10-15 minutes without getting on the interstate.) The room was very nice with a separate living room and bedroom, nothing spectacular but still very nice. I did appreciate the green efforts by the hotel which uses a keycard system to power the rooms (you insert your room key in a slot by the door upon entering which powers the entire room, then remove it when you leave and everything shuts off automatically in 30 seconds or so.) Didn't utilize the spa facility, but what I did see of them indicated standard, clean facilities. The staff was very friendly and helpful in offering tips to kill time (this wasn't much of a tourist area, so things to do are limited, but the
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here last week as part of a wedding celebration.  At first glance I thought we were staying at a lower end hotel.  However, once we entered it appeared I was wrong.  The place is nicer inside than out.  There is a small little reception area/front desk that's decorated nicely and a courtyard off the front room for people to gather and have drinks (which you can get from the bar in the hotel...which was nice since it was a wedding.)    The rooms are rather large and have a seperate sitting area with TV and couch.  The bathrooms are plenty big and have good, adjustable shower heads.  There wasn't much for shampoo, body soap, etc.  And what there was, wasn't great anyway.  The bed was excellent and so were the pillows.  They were just right for me, soft but not too hard.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is my first visit to the Ayres Hotel & Spa in Mission Viejo but it will not be my last stay at this hotel. The rooms are very nice and clean with a great King size bed, nice size bathroom, good sitting area and a refer with a freezer. The view from our window was over looking 241 with the mountains in the background. The staff are very friendly and make you feel like an important person.  The breakfast buffet is one of the best I have ever eaten at. All the hot dishes are hot and you can get freshly made items from the bar. All in all I had a great time staying here
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for the first time from 10/11/13-10/13/13.  We let them know ahead of time that we would arrive late as we were traveling from AZ.  They were great in accommodating us for the late arrival.  The staff was extremely helpful and pleasant to work with.  The made-to-order complimentary breakfast was better than many we have had.  My husband would not stop raving about how great the coffee was, and although I do not enjoy coffee as much as he does, I had to agree with him.  We didn't need to visit Starbucks during our trip. If I had to make improvements, I would tell the staff to alert guests to having to pay the $6.50 total on the toll roads to get to their hotel.  If there is a route anyone knows to avoid the two $3.25 tolls, then by all means...use it.
Manager Response: Dear Charli P.,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent stay at our hotel. Also, we are glad to see that you thought our team members were helpful and pleasant to work with. Our sincerest apologies if the cocktails available were not to your liking, hopefully the next time you come to stay with us we will be able to better quench your thirst. Summary: We stayed here for 6 nights at the end of September for a wedding.  Everything was wonderful.  I cannot think of 1 complaint.  Every staff member we encountered was pleasant.  Convenient for shopping, restaurants, and John Wayne Airport.  Breakfast was fine-it was the same pretty much every morning-but I was happy to have someone else making my breakfast.  Every request we had from housekeeping, front desk or kitchen employees was met with a smile.  Next time we are in the area, we will be staying at the Ayres.
Manager Response: Dear Carole1958,  We are so very pleased to see that you took the time to leave a fantastic 5 star review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your experience at our hotel; we are eternally grateful for your kind words. We truly strive to offer the most exceptional customer service and it is nice to know that we succeeded in that goal with your visit. Thank you for the compliments on the convenience of our location and complimentary full American breakfast buffet. Thank you again and we hope to see  you in the near future.  Sincerely, Didi Shields General Manager

Summary Heading: Comfortable relaxing stay, great hotel and staff
Summary: I recently moved from Rancho Santa Margarita and love coming to this hotel whenever I visit friends and family. I remember when this hotel was built less than 5 years ago so the rooms and facility are in great condition. I love sitting out in the courtyard and every morning there is a chef breakfast that includes made to order omelets. This facility shares the swimming pool with the Ayers suites directly beside it which I have equally enjoyed. I have yet to receive a massage but I have used the work out room and everything is clean and nice. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling in this area and I will definitely be back!
Manager Response: Dear Morgan J.,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your experience at our hotel. We are so thrilled to see that you enjoyed your visit and thought highly of the grounds and accommodations. Your compliments of the courtyard and complimentary full American breakfast buffet are greatly appreciated! We hope to see you in the near future and thank you again for recommending our hotel.  Sincerely, Didi Shields General Manager

Summary: Been hearing a lot about the Ayres hotel brand, so decided to give it a try.  Check-in was a breeze with no issues. We got a room on the 3rd floor, which was a handicap room. Bathtub had some extra bars and the closet rack was lower.  After some research found out this hotel was available on Priceline's name your own price. Booked it and got a rate that was about half of the asking rate on the hotel's website, which despite what hotels tell you (I've heard it all and don't believe any of it), is why you are given these types of rooms. It's to be expected. You're getting a room that will other wise go unsold and at half the price -- it's only logical. For those who complain about this, you're paying half price for a room, get over it.  The morning breakfast was good. A little

Summary: We loved our suite at Ayres Hotel & Spa Mission Viejo.  Rooms are clean, help is very courteous, and breakfast delicious.  will stay there again whenever in that area.  beautiful outdoor patio with pit.  location of hotel about 20 minutes from john wayne airport, about 20 minutes from coastal towns.  traffic good.
Manager Response: Dear rodi g.,  Thank you very much for taking the time to let others know about your experience at our hotel on TripAdvisor through a kindly worded, excellent 5 star review. We are so appreciative of the compliments on the cleanliness of our rooms, courteous team members, and delicious complimentary full American breakfast buffet. We cannot wait to welcome you again and look forward to your next visit to the area. Thank you again.  Sincerely, Didi Shields General Manager

Summary: We had a great experience, and would defiantly recommend this hotel to others! The staff is friendly and professional. The hotel is very clean! The breakfast in the morning was delicious. This is a super place to stay.

The staff is uniformly friendly and helpful, free wifi, and frankly much better all around that hotels three- or four-times the cost.  Very comfortable rooms.

Summary Heading: Great hotel but bring your own wi-fi
Summary: Positive experience with friendly and professional staff, but their wi-fi network is the weak link in the chain. Repeated attempts to log in were frustrated on both iPad and three separate smart phones. Usually the Ayres network was unavailable to our devices (simply did not appear in the menu of available networks) and on those occasions when it WAS available it would disappear after a login attempt. We brought our devices to the front desk but problems were not resolved. Note that suite DID include Ethernet cable for direct connection to the Internet, but that is not an option for smart devices (iPads, iPhones, etc.). Spent the better part of three days chained to a slow cellular data connection.

I grabbed scrambled eggs, potatoes, and sausage for my wife and took that to our room. Then went back and got the same for myself. Plus coffee and orange juice. We saw them preparing steaks and they looked high quality and delicious.  The restaurant was clean and nicely decorated with a courtyard and fountain.  The location was nice for a soccer tournament but not sure if best for all purposes because it is out in the suburbs.  Great b-fast in the morning--lots of selections and served professionally.  The value was excellent.  The only drawback might be the old style air conditioner that was rather loud. Bed super comfortable, though, so fell asleep quickly!  Had one bedroom suite and it was very spacious.  Would be perfect for a family of four!

We didn't love the "American" breakfast served each morning, but it was free and was good if you just wanted to pick up something quick on your way out the door.  Staff was very friendly. The grounds were welcoming - the outside courtyard was gorgeous and the fire pits were an added bonus. The staff were exceptionally professional and helpful. There was a nice variety of breakfast foods incluced with the room price.  We would recommend this property for anyone staying in the area.

We appreciate your recommendation and hope to welcome you back very soon.   Warm regards,   Didi Shields General Manager

Summary: Now this is the type of hotel I like - good service, clean, new, very comfortable beds, and no nickeling and diming. Free internet, free breakfast, great rooms, lovely decor. Not much to complain about at all. My only misgiving is that the hotel is quite a ways off the beaten path, and is only close to the toll road but not interstate 5. But the hotel itself is quite excellent.
Manager Response: Dear SoCa1l26 -  It was a pleasure welcoming you as our guest. Nothing pleases us more than to know a guest has left our hotel fully satisfied with his or her stay. What a treat to know that we were able to accomplish this in your case. While we are about 2 miles from the 5 freeway, we are very close to the 241 toll road. We also find that many guests enjoy the panoramic views of Saddleback Mountain that our location allows them. We appreciate your feedback and hope you will visit us again soon.   Sincerely,  Didi Shields General Manager

Summary Heading: Ayres Hotel & Spa Mission Viejo a Delightful Surprise!
Summary: We spent this past weekend at the Ayres Hotel & Spa Mission Viejo.  A co-worker of my husband's was getting married nearby and the bridal couple thoughtfully booked a block of rooms at this hotel and provided a van shuttle to and from the wedding venue.  We'd not stayed at an Ayres property previously and chose this property because of the arrangements made by the wedding party.  What a delightful surprise! We found the facilities immaculate, and our room was spotless.  Services at the hotel were beyond speedy and complete.  From the hearty front desk welcome, to the provision of extra pillows at midnight (with less than 2 minute request time) we found all the staff more than eager to help.  At one point just after check in, my husband realized he'd left batteries at home to

I am so pleased that you found everything from the full American breakfast to the accommodations so welcoming. We absolutely believe in providing the best hotel visit to our guests through warm, enthusiastic service, so it is wonderful to hear that your stay with us was so remarkable. We appreciate your recommendation and look forward to your return.   Warm regards,  Didi Shields General Manager

Summary: I have to say I love this hotel for the quiet and business orientated travelers.  The beds are the best as they allow for a good nights sleep.  Breakfast is always a plus with made to order omelets, fresh fruit, juices, coffee, danishs and an amazing waffle machine with strawberries and whip cream! One of the few hotels that still has a fridge and microwave.  A huge bonus for me.  With a grocery store accross the street and a beautiful courtyard, I enjoy my evenings although I am still stuck working on my work laptop.   Stay during the week for a nice happy hour.  Wednesday is my favorite with cheese, crackers and fresh fruit.  Thursday pizza is a nice thin crust local pizza. Although I wish it was a little bigger so that all my co-workers could stay there, the smaller size and
Manager Response: none

Summary: Really nice common areas promoting relaxation.  Rooms are nicely furnished and very clean.  Didn't try the restaurant it was closed on Sundays!  My first experience and I would definitely use them again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Stay here... and go to the spa!!!
Summary: All I can do is echo everything everyone else has said here... my husband and I had a great stay!  We also went to the spa for a couples massage.  Everyone is the spa was super nice and we got a great treatment.  Do yourself a favor... just book yourself a room here.  We can't wait to come back!!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Best hotel and best Value in a long time!
Summary: I've paid a lot more for a lot less. this place feels new. The decor was welcoming. The staff was great. Free breakfast and not the crummy pastry kind. It was a full breakfast. Even a guy who makes you omelets. It's a little off the beaten path but I was impressed so I do want to check out this chain again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: One of my favorite hotel chains.
Summary: I've stayed at various Ayres locations for years. Probably over 50 stays in all. I usually stay at the Mission Viejo Spa location. It's very new and they have very nice suites. My only suggestion would be change machines in laundry room and vending machine area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We got our accommodations as a voucher for a "get-away" and will be returning at full price! Sometimes, when using a coupon or voucher, service isn't quite as cheerful as it should be. It was wonderful to be greeted courteously and treated as a valued guest. Our room was very comfortable, with plenty of well-placed outlets for our electronic gizmos.   We decided to try dinner in the hotel's Modjeska Bar & Grill dining room after we checked in and were very glad we did. We started with the calamari appetizer and can honestly say it was the best -- and most tender -- calamari we've ever eaten. For entrees, we chose the lasagna, which had a wonderful blend of spices in the sauce, and the fish, shrimp and chips. Everything was perfectly prepared and we ate every bite,  We enjoyed

We hope to welcome you back very soon.   Warm regards,  Didi Shields General Manager

Summary: Stayed here again fr a couple days over Sping Break and everything was, once again, great.  The people are very friendly, the hotel is up to date and very clean, the food is good with enough variety, and they don't nickle and dime you at all.  It really is a great value all around and the hotel grounds, lobby and rooms are reminiscient of a much more expensive property.  They almost always seem to offer specials and discounts so watch the website or do a search for coupon codes before you book.
Manager Response: Dear 32635Julie -  Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to welcome you to Ayres Hotel & Spa Mission Viejo once again. Nothing is more satisfying for our team than to know that a guest has returned to our hotel and has once again had a comfortable hotel experience. We appreciate you taking the time to review our hotel and look forward to your return.  Safe travels,  Didi Shields General Manager

Summary: I just had the pleasure of spending two nights at the Ayres Hotel & Spa while in Mission Viejo visiting family and I highly recommend this hotel.  There is also an adjacent property called the Ayres Suites which has a pool and jacuzzi which is open to guests of both properties. You can get a great view of the mountains from the Suites side of the property. The hotel was very clean and the staff was friendly and efficient.  There is a great little bar/restauarnt on premises.  I didn't have an opportunity to try the food but it smelled wonderful.  The free breakfast buffet is very nice with a variety of hot & cold items.  I had a King Suite which had a wonderfully comfortable bed and was very spacious.  Large flat screen TVs in both the sitting room and the bedroom with a variety

A guest recommendation is the highest honor a hotel can receive so your endorsement is greatly appreciated. We look forward to your return.  Warm regards,  Didi Shields General Manager

Summary: Stayed here as part of a wedding block.  Had no issues.  I was able to map a route without tolls thanks to a function on my phone.  (Local roads off the I-5.)  Very friendly check-in staff, and definitely one of the better free breakfasts I've had.  Beds could be more comfy and towels softer, but it wasn't too bad.
Manager Response: Dear Steverinie -  We appreciate you choosing our hotel for your stay and for taking the time to share your experience with fellow travelers. We know a wedding is a wonderfully celebratory occasion that can also be stressful if the hotel of choice is not accommodating, so I am very pleased that we were able to provide you with the most comfortable stay during this happy time. We appreciate your feedback on the bedding and linens as well and will use these comments on future reviews of hotel offerings.  Warm regards,  Didi Shields General Manager

Summary: I discovered Ayres Hotel and Spa about 2 years ago when all of the national brand hotels were booked.  I was initially hesitant to book the Ayers as I didn't know it was what I wanted for a business trip.  Thankfully I tried them.  It is now my hotel of choice for every trip to Orange County.  The facility is spotless, the rooms are all suites, large, comfortable and up to date.  The staff is great, and there's a fantastic complimentary hot breakfast.  I think it the best choice in the area.
Manager Response: Dear Mike -  We appreciate you giving us the opportunity to show you how well the Ayres Hotels stand up against national brands. I am thrilled that we were able to provide you with the service and comfort upon your initial visit that endeared the hotel to you and made us your continued choice. We appreciate your very kind words and look forward to your return.  Safe travels,  Didi Shields General Manager

Summary Heading: Review of Ayres Hotel & Spa Mission Viejo
Summary: We have stayed a number of times at both the original hotel 'part' and the more recent Spa hotel. They are both excellent and of very high standard. The Ayres Hotel has a more traditional feel, whereas the Spa is perhaps more spacious and has more health/relaxation-related facilities. The latter has a triangular format with a centre forming a very relaxing inner courtyard with easy chairs etc and is particularly nice for sitting outside whilst having breakfast. Speaking of which, the breakfasts cover a full range from cereals, fruit, toast and cooked options etc. The staff in both hotels are extremely pleasant and helpful, nothing is a problem for them. The rooms/suites are spacious and spotlessly clean. The hotel is located next door to a Vons, which is particularly convenient.
Manager Response: Dear James -  Thank you very much for your positive feedback and for choosing our hotel for your stay on more than one occasion. It is wonderful to hear that you find everything from the accommodations to the complimentary full American breakfast to the location consistently satisfying. I also appreciate you acknowledging our sister hotel, Ayres Suites Mission Viejo, as the entire Ayres Hotels of Southern California chain works hard to provide the best possible hotel experience for our guests. I hope we will have the chance to welcome you again in the near future.  Sincerely,  Didi Shields General Manager

Summary: This is an amazing hotel.  The staff really goes above & beyond.  The property is clean and safe.

What a treat to hear that the service and cleanliness of the hotel made for such an enjoyable stay. I am lucky enough to work with a fabulous team so will be sure to share your comments with them as well. We look forward to your return.  Sincerely,  Didi Shields General Manager

Summary: When in the area for business, I always stay at the Ayres in Laguna Woods. This one week, they were totallly booked and offered a reservation at the nearby Mission Viejo. I was very pleased with my accomodations at the Mission Viejo Ayres.  On Los Alisos Boulevard, I found the hotel next to the 241 Foothill Toll Road which was very convenient to drive to my office near the Spectrum in Irvine.  I was greeted by Kenneth, who was very friendly and offered advice for local dining and getting around the immediate area.   The building for the Hotel is in a triangle shape with a open courtyard within.  My room was spacious with a couch facing a wall mounted TV along with a large desk. There was a microwave and small fridge (with separate freezer) under a granite topped cabinet. The

I am so pleased to know that we were able to live up to the very high standards of our sister property and that you thoroughly enjoyed your stay. Our front desk team takes great pride in providing the best possible service for our guests, so I will be sure to share your comments with them, Kenneth in particular, so they know their efforts are appreciated. I also appreciate your helpful comment regarding the drawer space and will bring this comment to the attention of our quality and design teams at the corporate office for use in future renovations. Thanks you again, and we hope to welcome you in the near future.  Warm regards,  Didi Shields General Manager

Summary: Nice place to stay.  Good location.  Front Desk (Dustin) was very helpful.  Spa staff very friendly - clean place overall.  Only points I would knock would be for the pool.  Located next door at other hotel.  Kitchen staff didn't clean plates off tables in the morning when tables were scarce.  Rooms were very clean.  Wifi worked great.  Fridge and microwave in room.  Would recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Basia61 -  Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel & Spa Mission Viejo for your stay and for letting fellow travelers know of your positive experience. A guest recommendation is the very highest honor a hotel can achieve, so I am thrilled that the service and accommodations led to such a remarkable hotel experience. Perhaps on your next visit you will have the opportunity to eat at the Modjeska Bar & Grill located in the hotel. We look forward to welcoming you again soon.  Sincerely,  Didi Shields General Manager

Summary: Spent a couple times here at the Ayres Hotel & Spa along with the couple's massage.  Service is excellent!  Tanya and Brad both were at the front desk reception area.  Cordial service!  They were helpful and friendly.  Rooms are nice and spacious.  Housekeeping was also at it's best service.  They replenished the bathroom amenities daily (unlike some places that do not when they see you still have the previous day's supplies)....the hotel is not "cheap".   Breakfast items and selections had a nice variety.   Very nice and cozy........the hotel is not as crowded as other "chain" hotels or big hotels......  Thank  you!!!
Manager Response: Dear Lin M -  It was an honor having you as our guest. Thank you for choosing our hotel and for sharing your experience on TripAdvisor. I have the privilege of working with a phenomenal front desk team who take immense pride in providing the best possible service for our guests and Tanya and Brad are an integral part of that team. I will be sure to share your comments with them so they know their efforts are recognized and appreciated. We appreciate your recommendation and cannot wait to have you back.  Safe travels,  Didi Shields General Manager

Summary: I have stayed here twice in the last month whilst on business and definitely would recommend. Plus sides for business are - rooms are big, breakfast is good, Wifi works very well, staff are good and for me (as a European) this hotel really is excellent value for money!
Manager Response: Dear Gregg -  Thank you so much for your kind review and for your continued patronage. I am very pleased that we are able to provide you with the amenities, service, and value that made your stay comfortable. We appreciate you choosing Ayres Hotel & Spa for consecutive visits and hope to welcome you back again soon.  Sincerely,  Didi Shields General Manager

Summary: I was traveling with my oldest son for a week's vacation in Southern California and we had a great stay at the hotel. Our original plans had us staying at another hotel, but after one unpleasent night there we decided to move to the Ayres. What a great move that was for us- as the Ayres' rooms were spacious and comfortable- with a sitting/family room that has a separate flat screen TV, offering another great place to relax and give you some space to spread out.  We enjoyed the breakfast- as it offered a nice variety of hot and cold foods.The hotel staff was also very friendly and helpful whenever we had a question or needed anything.   We would highly recommend the hotel!
Manager Response: Dear Hankmax -  Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel & Spa Mission Viejo for your stay and for taking the time to share your positive experience. We also appreciate your recommendation as a guest recommendation is the highest honor a hotel can receive. We hope you will stay with us again in the near future.  Warm regards,  Didi Shields General Manager

Summary: My husband and I arrived t 1:15 on a Friday for our couple's massage at 1:30. Very professional and very relaxing. We were able to check into our spacious room right after that. Since it was sunny, we enjoyed a time in the jacuzzi while another family was enjoying the pool. It was a lovely setting to enjoy the beautiful day. We enjoyed a drive around the area before settling in for dinner in the hotel restaurant. The waiter was very pleasant and we enjoyed the ambiance while sitting by the fireplace as we ate our yummy dinner. Young Korean women came in for their church retreat. It was a pleasure to see them all so engaged with one another and having a good time. We had a great night's sleep and had a wonderful free breakfast before taking off. A most pleasant night away.
Manager Response: Dear Ginny -  Thank you so much for your kind review of our hotel. It was wonderful to welcome you as our guests for the evening. Hopefully we will have the opportunity to welcome you again very soon.   Safe travels,   Didi Shields General Manager

Summary: Just returned from a week at the Ayres Hotel & Spa in Mission Viejo, and it was a refreshing change from many of the mainstream hotels that I stay in. The hotel is more cosy and comefortable than grand and glitzy, the rooms are generous and the staff genuinely helpful and friendly. I'll be back !

My husband is picky and rather demanding and the staff did not seem fazed by his requests. They did everything they could to make us comfortable and welcome!  The free breakfast on the weekends is good, not great because everything is in warming trays. Weekdays, the chef will make made-to-order eggs and those breakfasts are much better!

I also appreciate your comments regarding the breakfast and will share them with our breakfast team. We look forward to your next visit.  Safe travels,  Didi Shields General Manager

Summary: I was very satisfied with the hotel services, but there are some minor rooms for further improvement. - I am a Japanese, but no Japanese TV program such as NHK is available from the hotel TVs. - It is thought better to equip a safe in each room. - Probably some hotel rooms on the ground floor are facing parking.  The parked cars are very near to the rooms without appropriate blindfold.

As to the first floor rooms, please know that these rooms are exceedingly private and separated from the parking lot by 15 ft or more of landscaping. The windows are also equipped with black out curtains if a guest desires privacy and, for security reasons, the windows will not open beyond an inch so guest are assured of safety.   Thank you again for your review and I hope we will have the opportunity to host you again soon.  Regards,  Didi Shields General Manager

Summary: Great place to stay, decor really really nice, rooms truly upscale and staff there to treat you like you really are someone.

Loved the firepit in the courtyard. Also, it was great to have breakfast included in the cost of the overnight stay which made it easy for us to get in a healthy breakfast for my daughter before competition.  If we attend the same competition next year we will definitly be staying at the Ayeres Hotel & Spa in Mission Viejo

Summary: We had never stayed in Mission Viejo before and the Ayres Hotel was an excellent retreat from our busy lives.  The hotel was quiet and we slept very well.  In addition, the breakfast had many choices and was well managed.  Lastly, the free Internet was great as we went wired.  There are many mountain ranges just in the local vicinity via the toll freeways.  We hiked on two of them and saw beautiful sunsets and views of the coast.  There is also a Vons and some places to eat within walking distance.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We purchased a groupon spa package.  The room was rather plain and it overlooked the parking lot and street ... but it was the experience that was good.  Room service was prompt and the food was very good.  The couples massage was excellent -- one of the best I've had (and I've had plenty!)  The only potential snafu was that there was no mention upon check-in of the breakfast buffet.  There was no advertising of the breakfast in the room.  When we went down to leave for a breakfast we saw it being put away -- we were too late.  The general manager actually apologized and got us whatever food was available for us.  "Service with a smile."  So, for rectifying this one problem, the rating stayed an "excellent".
Manager Response: none

Summary: We often stay here while visiting our family who lives in Rancho Santa Margarita. This time we were very impressed by the staff and the cleanliness of the facility. We especially enjoyed the free WiFi which we had paid for just the day before in San Francisco. We also liked the 90 minute massage which was much appreciated durnig the hectic holiday season.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We are locals to the area but purchased a groupon for the hotel & spa. What an amazing relaxing day. We could ck in early, had the best massage ever, and I have had a few.  Sat poolside before and after the massage and topped it off with the jacuzzi. The 2 queen suite is amazingly clean as is the bathroom with the jacuzzi bathtub. We are on our way to the downstairs restaurant to get free appetizers nad champagne along w dinner. There is coffee for the morning and we are enjoying the 2 tv's even though we use them for background music. My daughter and I are enjoying the night away after a long holiday and a late 21st b-day celebration. I easilly rate the day/night a 10 out of 10!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel has a very boutique feel.  Excellent, friendly staff, very clean.   I have stayed at some great hotels (Ritz, Four Seasons) so I do have a pretty high standard of comparison and I have to say that these people have done a great job of balancing amenities and value.  We had a 1 bedroom suite stayed for 4 nights at $84 a night (breakfast included).  This was a special holiday rate but we would not have blinked at paying more for what we got.  I think the original price was like $126 and we were planning on booking at that rate before noticing the promotion.  We still would have felt like it was a bargain.  The rooms are a little sparse as far as decor but very clean and spacious. The courtyard is a special touch with the fireplace and cafe area.  Would definitely stay

Summary: Pleasant, up to date and comfortable!  Modern and great staff willing to help with all needs.

Summary: We needed a hotel to stay at on Thanksgiving Day while visiting relatives in nearby Ladera Ranch. The hotel was new, clean and comfortable! The Spa was a welcome addition which we took advantage of thanks to a $25 off coupon provided by Hotels.com. Our room had a view of the Santa Ana mountains and the adjacent Toll Road (Hwy 241). Other family members' rooms had views of a parking lot. The rooms were spacious; the King bed perfect. No complaints! Early check-in and out were much appreciated! The breakfast was standard fair and, as vegans, would  have liked more options. And as for the massage...absolutely relaxing!

Summary: Stayed at this hotel two nights in Mission Viejo, was in town for a wedding.  The basic room was about the size of a suite and had a very comfortable room, bed, and was exceptionally clean and well maintained.  The price was very reasonable.  The staff was helpful and courteous.   The breakfast was a hit with me and others in our party.  I would certainly not think twice about staying here again and hope I get the chance.  I hope to be able to stay longer.

The location is a bit off the I-5, but it's easy to drive down El Toro Rd.  All in all, a good place to stay and a good value compared to many other hotels in the area.

Be sure to check various websites before booking, because prices are all over the place--and check back several times, because they change a lot.

The staff is attentive to your every need and the property is clean and beautiful. We will stay there whenever we come back to OC from Phoenix because I am now spoiled for all other hotels in this price range. I do hope to catch one of their sales next time!

The staff was also really great. The 2 gentlemen at the front desk were always very polite attentive and sincere and so was the girl. They always greeted us and wouldnt just say hi and bye.They seemed genuinely interested in how we were doing. Good customer service is hard to find. The rooms were very nice. Spacious and this property seemed very new. The free breakfast was a nice touch and pretty good. If I am every back in the area which I doubt Id go back for sure.

My husband & I also stayed at the Alpine Ayres about a year ago - same pleasant stay.  I don't usually write reviews, but I've stayed at three different Ayres, and all three have been very enjoyable.

The front desk staff was great, the pool area has a wonderful view and the rooms were perfect. We went to the spa and both of the massage therapist were spot on. Its a small spa but perfect for us. They use great massage technique and its worth it. The comp breakfast in the morning was such a great touch. They have everything from waffles to omelets, fresh fruit and many more items. We had a wonderful time, thank you Ayers hotel staff, u made my birthday memorable.

It was a little far, but to be honest I liked being in the quiet and getting away from the noise and craziness every night. During the day my family would go driving through out all of California. I was disappointed when I had booked another hotel in California because after staying in this hotel the Radisson in Newport beach wasn't any where near how amazing this hotel was. I will definitly be booking this hotel EVERYTIME in California.

I brought it to the attention of the Front Desk in the following mornings and all I was told was sorry. There was no offer to move our rooms or anything to compensate us for 2 DAYS of lack of sleep. There are no security on the premises so any guest OR ANYONE can do anything they want and nothing will be done about it. WORST experience ever!!! DO NOT STAY THERE.
